result.execSummary:
The defendant Xander D. Serrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------

Possess no weapons. No BB guns.
------------------

No contact with the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent. No contact with co-actors. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Xander D. Serrano in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Xander D. Serrano.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing as to both files - 22CM328 & 22CM241 - **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**

Defendant Xander D. Serrano not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Xander D. Serrano.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim also present in court. Attorney has no reason why defendant is not in court. authorization on file. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Xander D. Serrano in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Xander D. Serrano. attorney requesting plea date. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM328 & 22CM241

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY WILLIAM SERRANO

DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH CURFEW FROM 9PM TO 6:30 AM, DEFENDANT MUST BE AT FATHER'S RESIDENCE. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. No social media. Defendant must attend school once released. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons including BB guns or facsimile guns. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.J.S. dob 8-26-2006 OR RESIDENCE, WITNESS S.L.V. dob 12-14-2005. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Xander D. Serrano in court. Attorney Brad Lochowicz for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. No victims in court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
